instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Just got in a board that had some heavy water damage to to the board near the LVDS connector. 2 Pins are actually blown off, came in with a green light, after unplugging the battery it would then go from green to orange. Put the board through the Crest and came out with no light on the charger. Checked the ISL area <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.38v. Tried removing edge bonding and reflowing the SMC no luck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Does it power on?? Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPGUB_G3H</SIGNAL>?? Have you tried another IO board and cable??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Does not power on no fan spin or green light. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.18v. I have tried a known good cable and IO board too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Voltage at <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>? Seems SMC is not working, maybe corrosion/crap under SMC, if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high put some flux to smc and apply heat to remove crap..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.38v, I have tried reflowing, and also removing and rebelling SMC. Still no light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Still 8.13V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>? could be corrosion on IO connector motherboard side or corrosion under battery connector.... measure data lines on battery connector in diode mode....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage Green Light -> No Green Light
threads.message: Probably crap under SMC. Pull if off the board and reball.
